author: Mrs. Priyambada Pandey
title: Look Younger in Your 50s - 15 Vegan Foods for Couples
text:
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†What does 100% vegan eat? These are the most interesting and searching questions for all the new vegan followers or my friends who think or may want to choose a vegan lifestyle.   ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† Another question that that comes to mind is "How to start eating vegan for beginners"?¬† Even if you're just trying to adopt a more plant-based diet for better health, these tips are a great way to start.¬† Dear friends, as per our topic "15 Foods that Healthy Vegan Couples Eat to Look More Younger in the Fifties,".¬†    Plant-based foods high in nutrients, such as legumes, whole grains, and tofu, are vital components of a vegan diet.¬†For ethical, health, or environmental reasons, vegans abstain from eating animal products.¬† A plant-only diet may offer certain health advantages, but it may also increase the risk of nutrient shortages for certain individuals.¬† This is particularly true for poorly designed vegan diets.¬†Eating a nutrient-rich diet full of whole and fortified foods is crucial for vegans who wish to maintain their health. Here are 15 foods and food groups you should definitely try to include in your vegan couple's diet plan to look younger in their fifties:  1. Lentils:¬†¬†Lentils are high in protein and fiber, making them ideal for soups, stews, and salads. 
2.¬†Chickpeas:¬†Chickpeas are a versatile legume that may be used in hummus, curries, and as roasted snacks. 3. Quinoa:¬†¬†A full protein grain that is ideal for salads and bowls. 4. Tofu:¬†Tofu is a soy-based protein that absorbs flavors well, making it great for stir fries and scrambles. 5.¬†Tempeh:¬†Tempeh is a fermented soy product that has a nutty flavor and is ideal for grilling or baking. 6. Almonds:¬†Almonds¬†are nutrient-dense almonds that can be eaten as snacks or made into almond milk. 7. Avocado:¬†Creamy and high in healthy fats, ideal for toast or salads.¬† 8: Sweet potatoes: Sweet potatoes are high in vitamins and taste delicious when roasted or mashed. 9: Kale: Kale is a nutrient-dense leafy green that may be used in salads, smoothies, and saut√©ing. 10. Chia Seeds:¬†High in omega-3s, ideal for puddings and smoothies. 11 Oatmeal: Oatmeal is a hearty breakfast choice that can be made into porridge or baked. 12. Black Beans: Black beans are high in protein and ideal for tacos, burritos, and soups. 13. Nutritional yeast:¬†Nutritional yeast¬†provides a cheesy flavor to foods and is high in B vitamins. 14: Bananas: Bananas are great for smoothies, baking, and as a natural sweetener. 15. Cashews: Cashews are creamy when mixed and can be used in sauces, cheeses, and desserts.  Introduction to Vegan Food Plans                        A diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and legumes is vital for aging healthily. This makes a well-planned vegan meal food essential for a youthful look. By sticking to a healthy vegan food plan, you can boost your overall health and well-being. It reduces the risk of chronic diseases and supports healthy aging. Key Takeaways  1. A healthy vegan food plan can help you look more youthful in your fifties. 2. A well-planned vegan meal plan can provide numerous health benefits. 3. Incorporating healthy vegan meals into your daily routine can improve your overall health and well-being. 4. A vegan diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and legumes can provide the necessary nutrients for healthy aging. 5. A well-structured vegan meal plan can help you achieve your health goals and maintain a youthful appearance Understanding How a Vegan Food Plan Impacts Aging  Exploring the benefits of a vegan lifestyle, you might ask how it affects aging. A well-planned vegetarian meal plan weight loss
 can reduce inflammation and oxidative stress.¬† These factors are key 
contributors to aging. By eating a variety of plant-based foods, you 
support your body's health as it ages. When looking into what does 100% vegan eat, focus on whole, nutrient-rich foods. A vegetarian meal plan weight loss
 includes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and legumes. These are 
packed with antioxidants and polyphenols, aiding in reducing 
inflammation and promoting aging health. The Science Behind Plant-Based Anti-Aging Research indicates that a plant-based diet can lower inflammation and oxidative stress. These are major aging factors. By eating a variety of plant-based foods, you give your body the nutrients it needs for healthy aging.  Key nutrients for youthful skin include vitamin C, vitamin E, and beta-carotene, found in many plant-based foods.    Key Nutrients for Youthful Skin in Vegan Foods A well-planned vegan diet offers many nutrients for healthy aging. Key nutrients for youthful skin include:   1. Vitamin C: found in citrus fruits, berries, and leafy greens. 2. Vitamin E: found in nuts, seeds, and whole grains. 3. Beta-carotene: found in sweet potatoes, carrots, and dark leafy greens   Incorporating these nutrients into your diet can help promote healthy aging and reduce aging signs.   Essential Vegan Superfoods to Look More Younger in Your Fifties Incorporating superfoods into your vegan meal plan can 
significantly aid in healthy aging. Kale, spinach, and berries are 
packed with antioxidants and nutrients.¬† These elements help combat 
inflammation and support youthful skin. By adding these superfoods to 
your healthy vegan meals, you can enjoy numerous health benefits and appear more youthful in your fifties. A well-thought-out vegan meal plan must include a variety of superfoods for optimal nutrition. Key superfoods to consider are:¬†¬†  Nuts and seeds, which provide healthy fats and protein Whole grains, which offer fiber and essential vitamins Leafy greens, such as kale and spinach, which are rich in antioxidants Berries, which are high in antioxidants and other nutrients    By integrating these superfoods into your healthy vegan meals, you can foster healthy aging and lower the risk of age-related diseases. A well-planned vegan meal plan can make you look and feel younger, even in your fifties.   "With a little planning and creativity, you can create delicious and nutritious healthy vegan meals that will help you thrive in your fifties and beyond."   Creating Your Anti-Aging Vegan Meal Strategy To start eating vegan, creating a well-planned vegan food plan is crucial for healthy aging.  A vegan meal strategy ensures you get the nutrients for energy, skin health, and cellular repair. Begin with morning ritual foods like oatmeal with fruit and nuts. They offer sustained energy and fiber. In the afternoon, add power foods like leafy greens and berries. These promote skin health and provide antioxidants.  For evening meals, focus on whole grain bowls with roasted vegetables and lean proteins. A structured vegan food plan helps you reach your health goals and maintain youthful energy. Morning Ritual Foods for Youthful Energy 1. Oatmeal with fruit and nuts 2. Smoothie bowls with spinach and banana 3. Avocado toast with scrambled tofu  Following a well-planned vegan food plan ensures you get all necessary nutrients for healthy aging. Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water. With some planning, you can craft a vegan meal strategy that supports healthy aging and youthful energy.    Afternoon Power Foods for Skin Health  In the afternoon, include power foods like leafy greens and berries. These promote skin health and provide antioxidants. Examples include:1. Leafy green salads with berries and nuts. 2. Roasted vegetable wraps with hummus. 3. Quinoa bowls with grilled vegetables and lean protein sources.  Incorporating these power foods into your vegan food plan supports healthy aging. It also ensures your skin gets the nutrients it needs for optimal health. Conclusion: Embracing the Youth-Preserving Power of Veganism A well-planned vegan meal plan can be a powerful tool for promoting healthy aging and reducing the risk of chronic diseases.  By incorporating the 15 healthy vegan foods outlined in this article into your daily routine, you can experience a wide range of benefits. These include glowing skin and increased energy levels. Remember, transitioning to a vegan lifestyle doesn't have to happen overnight. Start by gradually incorporating more plant-based meals into your diet.  Let your body and taste buds adjust to the changes. With patience, dedication, and the right guidance, you can unlock the youth-preserving power of veganism. Enjoy a healthier, happier life well into your fifties and beyond. FAQs (Frequently asked Questions) Q: What is a vegan food plan?A: A vegan food plan excludes animal products like meat, dairy, and eggs. It focuses on plant-based foods. These include fruits, vegetables, whole grains, legumes, nuts, and seeds.   Q: What are the benefits of a vegan food plan for healthy aging?A: A well-planned vegan diet offers many benefits for aging healthily. It reduces inflammation and improves skin health. It also lowers the risk of chronic diseases. Plant-based foods are rich in antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals that support cellular repair and youthful appearance.    Q: What are some essential vegan superfoods for looking younger?A: Key vegan superfoods for a youthful look in your fifties include kale, spinach, berries, nuts, seeds, and whole grains. These foods are rich in nutrients like vitamin C, vitamin E, and beta-carotene. They support skin health and reduce aging signs.   Q: How can I create an effective anti-aging vegan meal strategy?A: To create an effective anti-aging vegan meal strategy, focus on nutrient-dense foods. Start with energizing foods like oatmeal with fruit and nuts. Include power foods like leafy greens and berries in the afternoon. Finish with whole grain bowls with roasted vegetables and lean protein sources in the evening. This promotes cellular repair.   Q: How can a vegan diet help couples look and feel younger?  A: Couples on a vegan diet together can enjoy many benefits. These include weight loss, improved health, and a youthful appearance. Sharing a plant-based lifestyle supports each other. It allows for trying new recipes and experiencing the anti-aging effects of a well-planned vegan diet.

author: shamayimjewishanimaladvocacy
title: From Fruit to Flourishing: Rethinking Tu B‚ÄôShevat in the 21st Century
text: The Jewish holiday, known as New Year for Trees, or Tu B‚ÄôShevat, is celebrated on the fifteenth day of the Hebrew month of Shevat. Even though Tu B‚ÄôShevat is not as widely observed as popular Jewish holidays, like Rosh Hashanah or Passover, it has important spiritual, ethical, and ecological significance.¬† What is Tu B‚ÄôShevat? What is the purpose of the holiday?¬† Tu B‚ÄôShevat has historically signaled the start of Israel‚Äôs fruit-bearing season. Farmers used this time to evaluate the health of their fruit trees and determine how much tithing they would have to pay for their produce. Over time, Tu B‚ÄôShevat has become a day to consider the relationship between humans and the natural world and to raise awareness of environmental issues.¬† How Does Veganism Tie Into Tu B‚ÄôShevat? ¬†In line with the tenets of veganism, Tu B‚ÄôShevat provides a potent framework for examining the moral aspects of our relationship with nature. The festival promotes mindful consumption and a sense of thankfulness for the earth‚Äôs abundance. By honoring nature‚Äôs blessings, Tu B‚ÄôShevat challenges us to think about how we affect the environment and the moral implications of the foods we eat.¬† With its emphasis on reducing animal suffering and advancing sustainable food systems, veganism strongly reflects the values of Tu B‚ÄôShevat. We can lessen animal suffering, lessen our environmental impact, and develop a more sustainable and caring relationship with the planet by adopting plant-based diets.¬† The Environmental Influence and Tu B‚ÄôShevat Relationship The concept of environmental consciousness is closely related to Tu B‚ÄôShevat. It inspires us to recognize our duty to preserve the environment, to value the beauty and fragility of nature, and to develop a closer bond with the natural world.¬† The holiday highlights the value of trees in preserving ecological harmony, supplying oxygen and slowing down global warming. In observance of Tu B‚ÄôShevat, many communities plant trees ‚Äì¬† a concrete act of environmental stewardship that represents hope for the future.¬† The Importance of Fruit and Tu B‚ÄôShevat¬† An important part of Tu B‚ÄôShevat celebrations is fruit. Participants, in a traditional Tu B‚ÄôShevat Seder, eat a range of fruits that are indigenous to the Land of Israel, including dates, pomegranates, grapes, figs, and olives. These fruits are prized not only for their flavor, but also as representations of the earth‚Äôs abundance and the cyclical nature of life.¬† Here are a few recipe ideas:¬† Pomegranate salad: A crisp and colorful salad with feta cheese mixed greens toasted walnuts and pomegranate seeds. Here is the recipe link.¬† Date and walnut loaf: It is made with dates, walnuts and whole wheat flour. It is a tasty and nutritious treat. Why not check out the recipe and try it today?¬† Fig Jam: It is made with fresh figs. This sweet and tangy jam is ideal for baking or spreading on toast. Here is where you can find the recipe.¬† Tu B‚ÄôShevat: An Opportunity for Development and Renewal The Torah places a strong emphasis on the value of trees and how they support life. ‚ÄúWhen you besiege a city for a long time in your war against it to capture it you shall not destroy its trees by wielding an axe against them for you may eat from them and you shall not cut them down for is the tree of the field a man that it should be besieged by you?‚Äù is a verse found in Deuteronomy 20:19. This verse emphasizes the value of protecting natural resources and the respect that trees should receive. In addition to celebrating the abundance of nature, Tu B‚ÄôShevat is a time for reflection and rejuvenation.¬† We are prompted to consider our relationship with the earth and to work toward both individual and group development. Tu B‚ÄôShevat serves as a reminder of the cyclical nature of life and the significance of ongoing renewal and growth much like trees that lose their leaves in the fall and reappear in the spring.¬† A Global View of Tu B‚ÄôShevat Celebrations Around the World Despite its Jewish origins, Tu B‚ÄôShevat has the potential to become a worldwide celebration of environmental awareness and action. The holiday‚Äôs central theme of appreciation for nature and the value of environmental stewardship transcends national borders even though the customary emphasis on Israeli fruits is still important.¬† Global Tree Planting ‚Äì On Tu B‚ÄôShevat, communities everywhere can take part in tree-planting campaigns. This could entail putting native trees in one‚Äôs backyard neighborhood, parks, or community gardens.¬† Honoring Regional Fruits and Produce ‚Äì Local fruits and vegetables can be served at a Tu B‚ÄôShevat Seder to help families celebrate and develop an appreciation for the variety of nature in their own areas.¬† Assisting environmental organizations ‚Äì Environmental organizations that focus on conservation, reforestation, and mitigating the effects of climate change can be supported by individuals.¬† Educating Children ‚Äì Tu B‚ÄôShevat lessons can be incorporated into the curricula of schools and other educational institutions to teach kids the value of sustainable living and environmental preservation.¬† Encouraging sustainable food choices and veganism ‚Äì The ethical and environmental consequences of our food choices can be brought to light on Tu B‚ÄôShevat. The holiday can be celebrated with talks and educational events about sustainable food systems and plant-based diets. Within Jewish spaces, Tu B‚ÄôShevat celebrations can serve as a relevant way to explore and celebrate vegan ethics as an expression of Jewish values.¬† By fitting the celebration to fit both Jewish and global contexts, we can make Tu B‚ÄôShevat a truly worldwide movement for plant-based education, environmental awareness, and action. This approach also inspires a closer bond with the natural world and motivates people to take significant action in the direction of a more sustainable future. In Conclusion Tu B‚ÄôShevat provides a special chance to contemplate our moral obligations, commune with nature, and adopt a more sustainable and caring lifestyle. By observing this holiday with awareness and purpose, we can foster a greater sense of gratitude for the abundance of the planet and work toward a more equitable and sustainable future for everybody. Photo by Meri√ß Tuna: https://www.pexels.com/photo/solitary-tree-in-vibrant-yellow-canola-field-29989540/ Recent posts Man‚Äôs Best Friend: Navigating the Jewish Relationship with¬†Dogs February 2025 Newsletter From Fruit to Flourishing: Rethinking Tu B‚ÄôShevat in the 21st¬†Century

author: Madrigal Delusions
title: Madrigal‚Äôs miscellaneous Meanderings
text: So, like I said in my previous letter, this is going to be a bit of a meandering slog of everything I‚Äôve been getting up to from late October to Mid-December. I know that‚Äôs only two months but when I‚Äôve been getting up to so much every day that I feel like I could write an individual post for almost every single one of these events. Hope y‚Äôall enjoy my ramblings. China Vegan Summit My friend, Rose, and I went to the vegan conference in Suzhou, a town about 1 hour drive out of Shanghai. I didn‚Äôt end up taking many photos because I was having a lot of fun walking around and trying out the different things. Unfortunately, and very frustratingly, one of the first things I was offered contained honey‚Ä¶It can be annoying how the term can get watered down so easily. I remember that the summit was maybe a 3-day event, I only went for the first day and I‚Äôll be honest I found it a little bit annoying. I think I would personally have labelled the summit to be a ‚ÄúPlant-based Business Summit,‚Äù there‚Äôs nuance there that is lost when the term Vegan is used instead. Ultimately the summit was about how to market your business to people who eat plant-based, which includes Vegans, but the general consensus is because Vegans are morally driven they‚Äôll seek out and find your business regardless of marketing, so instead marketing should be targeted towards people who eat a plant-based diet for health/environment/trend-hoppers. I did have a fun chat with someone from Europe who was doing research into how Vegans are perceived in society, the hindrances that they face and the differences between the perception of Vegans in Europe and in China. I kind of don‚Äôt think they were qualified to talk about it too much because I found out towards the end that they only spoke introductory Chinese. Maybe they found a way around that but when you‚Äôre measuring public perception, I can‚Äôt help but feel like you should be able to speak to the public. My friend wants to start a plant-based business though so I think it was very good for them and I got a tote bag with goodies so I‚Äôm not too upset. Dinners Galore I have been eating so many dinners, and so much good vegan food, you would not even believe. I‚Äôve been posting a lot of the raw photos on an album tucked away on the website but I‚Äôll also take this opportunity to share some of the food I‚Äôve been eating while kicking about Shanghai. I‚Äôve tried to put where I got the food in the name of the photos so you should be able to hover over and see, but if you can‚Äôt or you have any specific questions about any just let me know in the comments below and I can provide specific details. This isn‚Äôt even close to everything I‚Äôve eaten here, of course, and don‚Äôt let my poor photography skills put you off, all this food was so delicious. Honestly being vegan in China has been an absolute treat. I‚Äôve eaten more good food here than I ever would have expected. Most of these photos are from Shanghai, but everywhere I‚Äôve gone I‚Äôve eaten really well. Please browse to the page to see this content. Miscellaneous sightings Just a small selection of photos that I took while wandering around Shanghai that don‚Äôt really fit into any theme but that I found interesting. I‚Äôll leave it up to you to decide why I like each of these photos. Please browse to the page to see this content. Coffee Tasting I went to a fancy coffee tasting event which was advertised by the Australian Trade organisation. There was a famous Melbourne barista in town just to make coffee for the event. They were experimenting with some specific milk blend, and me being the fool that I am forgot that people put cows milk in their drink. Fortunately I realised before they made my coffees and they were quick to supplement it out for regular oat milk instead. The Ethiopian Bench Maji really stole the show. Just a really wonderful blend. This was the first good coffee I‚Äôve had in a while since living in Shanghai, so it‚Äôs a bit of a poisoned apple because now I have to go back to my regular Chinese coffee which just‚Ä¶isn‚Äôt there yet. While sitting down I struck up a conversation with a fellow ËÄÅÂ§ñ who was 100% American but because I‚Äôm terrible with accents thought he was a fellow Aussie. Turns out he and his partner work at Shanghai Disneyland. It was super interesting hearing about how they have to take the ideas that they have in their head and then engineer them into reality. I really think that art plays a big part in pushing for innovation and change. After drinking my coffee I went for a lovely city walk and saw lots of fun little sights. Art for Hearts ‚Äì Charity sale I went to a charity art sale for children with heart disease, a good excuse to buy some nice art. I really vibed with a bunch of pieces‚Ä¶but for some reason all the pieces that I really liked were between 3,000 and 10,000 Kuai! I‚Äôll take that as me just having good taste‚Ä¶and unfortunately out-of-my-budget tastes. Actually the art that I liked the most was from the person wearing the capybara outfit. I unfortunately spent so much time pondering it that I forgot to take a photo. Everyone around me felt like it represented a cool, calm, and peaceful day, but I felt like underneath the pleasant colours there was a harshness of figure, and sharp aggressive lines. There were three pieces in the series and I felt like they were telling a story about love, with the first being explosive, the second being cold, and the third being peaceful. I felt like the theme was appropriate considering the theme of hearts. People were quite insistent that the author was trying to represent peacefulness in all three, but I think that‚Äôs a much more boring interpretation personally. I ended up buying a small Autumn scene which was pleasant but nothing special for 300 Kuai. It makes me want to collect all four seasons while I‚Äôm here though, so maybe we‚Äôll see about picking up some winter art of similar dimensions before it‚Äôs too late. My friend was helping to provide womanpower for the setting up and un-setting of the displays so I got a bit of a peek behind the scenes and I could feel an undertone of anxious drama going on with the management but unfortunately didn‚Äôt get any specific goss. There was also a separate section that was made by kids and there were some really nice pieces there too. I think they shouldn‚Äôt have told the audience that those were made by children because some really stood on their own merit. Tang Dynasty Roleplay I went to a roleplaying event where we got to roleplay as people living in an ancient town in the Tang dynasty. There‚Äôs a story that is going on behind the scenes and it‚Äôs up to us to figure out what‚Äôs going on. It was interesting working in a group on this one because literally everyone in our group basically work as detectives full-time so the plot was absolutely demolished. Despite my expert detective skills, I was not much help‚Ä¶to be fair it‚Äôs hard to solve a mystery in a language that you can‚Äôt speak. So instead of doing much detective work I put my other skills to the test and decided to make it my quest to flirt with the princess NPC until she gave in and let me rule the kingdom from the shadows as her boytoy. Also a difficult task when you don‚Äôt share a language, but you can see me adorning myself with bits and pieces from the set to present to her. My signature move giving her my card of hearts to represent my love. Anyway, while I was flirting with the princess, and for a very pretty boy who I mistook to be the princess, and also perhaps committing a little bit of theft and getting locked up in a cell, the rest of my team was busy discovering that the princess had been killed and replaced by an evil spirit several months ago‚Ä¶ but my love can transcend the mortal plain. Then when push came to shove and a large fight ensued I pulled a fish that I‚Äôd stowed up my sleeve for just such an occasion and began swinging! Long story short you‚Äôve got to be careful not to anger a boy with a fish up his sleeve or you might just get codded. Our team ended up winning the event‚Ä¶I like to think that I played an important role in that. After my flirting and subsequent codfighting I felt like I needed to blow off some steam and moved over to try some archery. I was actually shockingly good at this, after not putting enough umph into my first shot I was literally every shot hitting the centre ring and occasionally hitting the bullseye. Imagine how much better I‚Äôd have been doing if I had glasses that actually match my prescription. I do have a video of me shooting a straight bullseye floating around somewhere but I‚Äôll have to hunt it down to present it to y‚Äôall. Sarah Chang ‚Äì Violin Concert After a bit of a rough mental health period and sheltering myself from the world for a couple of weeks I decided that I had to kick myself back into action and take myself out on some nice nights out. So I booked some tickets for Sarah Chang, a famous violinist, and took myself out on a really lovely little night. I grabbed dinner at Duli, made my way across to Fortunate Vegan for a mango chia dessert. I found a hidden bar disguised as a rock-wall that you could crawl through and then up a flight of stairs into a cozy little speakeasy. I grabbed myself a drink, chatted with some people there before making my way out to the concert hall. I really love how many hidden gems there are tucked around Shanghai. The concert was really amazing, they played three beautiful pieces and then, because encores are such a big thing in China they came out to play another piece‚Ä¶ and then because encores are such a big thing in China they came out to play another piece‚Ä¶and then, I‚Äôll save you some time. They played five encores. That was a lot even for China, but I‚Äôm not complaining. Honestly, it must be so difficult to play with such emotion for such a long time, then to do it again and again, day after day, is absolutely jaw-dropping. It‚Äôs made me want to pick up the violin but I‚Äôve had a lot of difficulty finding a teacher. Please browse to the page to see this content. China art museum Set in an absolutely stunning building and filled with art chosen to celebrate and preserve Chinese art and culture the China Art Museum was absolutely one of the most stunning galleries I‚Äôve been to in a long time. Trying to capture just the sheer beauty and scale of the building the art is housed in is a challenge that I miserably failed. Standing there looking up as the building looms over you, the brutalist aesthetic making you feel like this was designed for giants, creates a sense of awe that is just impossible for me to capture. There was so much art in here that captured my attention and heart, but alas we‚Äôre rushing this post out the door so that we can catch up to the present. By the end of the day I was genuinely just mentally exhausted, the amount of art in this building was just insurmountable to tackle each piece in a meaningful way. I reckon you could spend three days just looking at all the art in the galleries. A piece that captured my eye in particular was this one: It‚Äôs depicting the battle of Shanghai, where the Japanese aggressor pushed their way into the city during World War II. It‚Äôs quite harrowing to be standing there in front of the painting, that shows somewhere where I‚Äôve stood in real life, watching a scene of desolation play out. The only colour in frame being the destructive fire burning through the city. I stood in front of this painting for a long time. Some other players that I really liked, or otherwise caught my attention, below. Please browse to the page to see this content. The 1933 Slaughterhouse Located near the Jewish holocaust survivor museum lies the 1933 Slaughterhouse a place where gutters were carved out of the concrete floor for rivers of blood to funnel away from the killing floors. The walls sit almost a metre thick, to shelter the surrounding buildings from any harrowed sounds. Along the webbed architecture lies sharp corners for people to hide in, if the cattle were to panic and stampede. Canals weave up and around leading towards the tower in the centre with a floor made out of grates. The 1933 Slaughterhouse was retired sometime in the last century and while many flock to it for its unique infrastructure, I find it hard to walk along the rugged pathways, sharp so that the cattle wouldn‚Äôt slip, and not be reminded that every facet of this building was designed to lead living creatures to the tower in centre with a floor made out of grates. It‚Äôs currently serving as a shopping mall and office building‚Ä¶it was an interesting place to visit, I hope that one day it‚Äôs used to remind us of a bygone era. Please browse to the page to see this content. ‰∏äÊµ∑ÂΩì‰ª£Ëâ∫ÊúØÂçöÁâ©È¶Ü Shanghai, museum of contemporary arts Located in an old shipbuilding facility near the river lies the Shanghai Museum of Contemporary Arts. I‚Äôve actually been here before when I was looking for some weird and unusual furniture, however they had an entire new gallery open and my weird seats were all gone. Instead someone parked their plane in the middle of the room‚Ä¶I don‚Äôt think anyone told them that they can‚Äôt park there. Not much of the art really struck a cord with me, I felt like a lot of it was very pretty, and very visually interesting, but I just couldn‚Äôt personally pin down much significant meaning to them. The signature piece for example features a tractor, car, aeroplane, and a rocket piercing up through a cloth sky made of second-hand clothing. There‚Äôs a lot of meaning that I could ascribe to it in regards to how we progress technology but then leave behind the people on the ground but I‚Äôm definitely stretching. There‚Äôs a small crack in the wall with a tiny fragment of light peeking through. Take a closer look and you can see a small mosquito trapped behind glass trying to get out. What is it thinking, embalmed in this artwork. (don‚Äôt worry, it‚Äôs just a video screen) There‚Äôs several other aesthetic pieces that I‚Äôll just share in a big chunk, some of them were interesting but I found most just to be aesthetically pleasing. Please browse to the page to see this content. Hidden at the back of the gallery behind a black curtain lies a golden horn far into the distance. The dark room making it impossible to gauge how far back it goes. As you approach you hear a chanting sound. You feel unwelcome, yet drawn closer to the horn. When you wake up you‚Äôre not sure whether the hall was real, but the golden horn remains in your memory. Painting with Friends I‚Äôve been doing some painting with some new friends at Fortunate Vegan Cafe, it‚Äôs a lot of fun just painting and chatting with people. I find it also helps to keep me encouraged to paint‚Ä¶maybe I‚Äôm more of a social creature than I thought. When I come back to Perth I‚Äôm looking forwards to setting up my own painting group. It‚Äôs more fun painting with friends, especially when you‚Äôre waiting for watercolours to dry. I‚Äôve been playing with colours lately, just trying new stuff out and trying to make my colours more symbolic than realistic. Please browse to the page to see this content. Vegan Thanksgiving I attended my first Thanksgiving event, wholly vegan of course, it was a lot of fun, and the people who hosted it also put on like an amateur talent show which I thought was a lot of fun. It made me realise that we don‚Äôt really have a lot of social avenues that allows people to kind of show of their skills, but also to show off their skills that they‚Äôre not very good at with no stakes. It was nice that people were singing, poorly, and doing kind of amateur dancing, and there was no sense of shame or embarrassment. It was a really welcoming and open environment where people could just get up and do their thing. Lots of people danced along and sang along to some songs, myself included, and all in all it was a lot of fun. I think it‚Äôs important to give people avenues to just have fun in public, and to showcase skills even if they‚Äôre not perfect but just for the sake of showcasing them. I really appreciate the homely vibe that the vegan community has in Shanghai. I didn‚Äôt love the food unfortunately, it was okay but they did it buffet style which isn‚Äôt this places specialty. Interpretive Dance I went to an interpretive dance performance with my friend, and the performer was absolutely incredible. The way they contorted their body seemed to break the limits of human form, creating a presence that denied the creature any semblance of humanity. The show begins with a jagged dagger of light carving its way up the stage, slicing through the darkness like a wound. From this wound, a grotesque, hunched figure emerges, crawling naked across the stage. The creature moves with an unsettling grace its motions disjointed and inhuman as it were tries to experience the world for the first time. As the audience watches this primal creature as it comes across as both entirely natural and because of that, completely inhuman. It is only when the creature dons a dress that it begins to take on a semblance of human form, driving home the message that humanity is not inherent but is instead bestowed upon those who conform to societal norms. The woman then makes her way around the stage, collecting rocks and placing them in the centre as though preparing for some kind of ritual. Though we cannot fully understand the cultural or symbolic significance of her actions, there is an undeniable sense of rightness, as if she is enacting something tribal. The pillar she builds, constructed from the burdens she has gathered, becomes the centre of her celebration. She dances around it celebrating this creation until the dawn breaks. As the celebration ends, she attempts to carry these burdens with her, but she soon discovers the crushing weight of what she has gathered. No matter how much she conforms, she is unable to bear the expectations that society places upon her. The delicate balance she struggles to maintain falters over time, and inevitably, she fails. As her life falls apart we are reminded of the impossibility of carrying the full weight of societal demands. In the next act, the stage transforms, and a field of golden wheat is sown across the floor, covering the stage. The woman now adorned in a dress of shimmering gold that blends seamlessly with the wheat, symbolizing her merging with the land and the spirit of nature itself. As she moves we see that the wheat flows with her, for her dress is the field. The next part is hard to get around but I‚Äôm pretty sure she has the interpretive dance version of sex Afterwards, a matriarch comes out to adorn her in glimmering gold. Our woman now shimmering in the light erupts across the stage in bursts of violent, explosive movements, scattering dazzling darts of energy in every direction. From this chaotic and glittering shower a child is born. In the end the creature, having completed its journey, crawls back through the wound in the wall from which it first emerged. The light ekes away, and the stage is enveloped in darkness, leaving the audience to wonder at the life that we just witnessed. Please browse to the page to see this content. So, at first I thought that this show was an interpretive way of showing us the burdens that capitalism place on us, but as we went further I realised that it was almost certainly talking about the expectations that society places on women and how they crush the people beneath them. I got to talk with the dancer afterwards, who also created the dance and she more or less confirmed that it‚Äôs about the expectations society place on women and women‚Äôs role in society. I have to share with you the notes that I took during the show because they‚Äôre very funny imo: Segments: Naked wiggle collecting rocks Stack those stones bby dancefrog rocky burdens r us Mommy incoming? fabric camel BODY SLAPPIN! Glitterprep Glittershimmer Glitterbirth? Back into the crack Misc note At start natural, presents unnatural to us, normality adorned humanity collects things, celebrate, things become burden, burden must be carried, things deny humanity Tribal dance, tribal dance requires things, participate in society you need to carry burdens, facilitate humanity Therefore the system demands sacrifice to participate in humanity, but strips you of your capacity to be human in doing so? Tribal appears weird when one does it, possible large group it becomes socially accepted. Desert scene, possible sex into golden childbirth? Woman focus is on burdens, and expectations? Probably about womanhood, hate to just assume that something‚Äôs about being a woman because it‚Äôs starring a woman Themes: Capitalism, seems to indicate that you lose your humanity if you don‚Äôt participate in the social expectations demanded of us, requires carrying burdens, sacrificing time, harvesting the ground. [likely] Womanhood, burdens that society place on women to perform labour, ties between fertility and the land, note that upon ‚Äòfulfilling‚Äô societal expectations (motherhood) she is able to escape the prying eye of the audience. (Possibly womanhood throughout history?) Postscript So, that‚Äôs mostly been what I‚Äôve been getting up to from about September to November, it‚Äôs pretty wild to think that I‚Äôve been away from Australia for 10 months now. I haven‚Äôt been dating since September, just been focusing on having a great time in Shanghai, and hiking around Zhejiang province. I‚Äôve talked to my boss about extending my contract so that‚Äôs up in the pipeline, I think once I get confirmation and sign the contract I might get back into dating. I‚Äôm feeling really good about how I‚Äôm doing, even if my apartment is often quite a bit of a mess. As I‚Äôm writing this I‚Äôm a little ill, and I made the mistake of washing my bedsheets, you might not immediately understand why this is a mistake but the reason is that my washing machine actually controls the weather in Shanghai and when I turn it on it guarantees that it‚Äôll rain‚Ä¶so it‚Äôs currently raining. As some of you know I don‚Äôt do New Years resolutions, instead I do seasonal themes which are four month ‚Äòthemes‚Äô that I use to help guide how I want to live in the next four months. My seasons align with the New Year, and you can blame the world for not aligning the actual seasons to the Gregorian calendar. It sometimes takes me a while to figure out what my ‚Äòtheme‚Äô will be, this time last year my theme was ‚Äòchange‚Äô and so whenever faced with two options I‚Äôd choose the one that required me to change. I‚Äôve had a lot of exciting themes since then, but every now and then you need a mellow one. So this season my theme is ‚Äòroutine,‚Äô I‚Äôm starting with my sleeping routine and I‚Äôve gotten that somewhat under wraps. I‚Äôve gotten my eating much more consistent and been making good records of my diet for tracking. I‚Äôve also booked a meeting with a fitness instructor, I think a big roadblock to me working out or committing to exercise was trying to figure it all out on my own‚Ä¶ but actually why would I ever bother doing it on my own? I can just pay someone to help me. It‚Äôs expensive to start off with but after I‚Äôve got the plan and some guidance on how to follow it I figure I can go it on my own after that. Once I‚Äôve got my core functions under good routine I‚Äôm going to be making scheduled times to work on my art, my piano, and also on catching up with people so hopefully things get a lot more organised. It‚Äôs not something that I plan to keep up forever, but for the next 4 months I‚Äôll be trying all this out and seeing what works for me and what doesn‚Äôt. Aaaanyway, after all that rambling I‚Äôll say goodbye. Next up I‚Äôll be telling you all about my trip to Japan, so stay tuned for that.

author: Millicent Prince
title: Unveiling the Truth About Raw Plant-Based Diets: Benefits, Misconceptions, and Nutritional Insights
text:
The raw plant-based diet, which focuses on consuming uncooked and unprocessed plant foods, has gained traction for its potential health benefits. Proponents argue that raw food diets promote better health, increase energy, and prevent chronic diseases. But what is the science behind these claims, and how does a raw plant-based diet impact nutrition? 



Understanding the Raw Plant-Based Diet



A raw plant-based diet emphasizes consuming fruits, vegetables, nuts, seeds, grains, and legumes that are either raw or minimally processed. The idea is rooted in the belief that heating food above a specific temperature destroys essential nutrients and enzymes that aid digestion and improve overall health. While the concept has existed for centuries, it gained popularity in the 21st century with the rise of health-conscious communities and wellness influencers promoting its potential benefits. 



The diet focuses heavily on unprocessed, natural foods, excluding meat, dairy, and other animal-based products. By nature, the diet is rich in plant-based foods packed with vitamins, minerals, fiber, and antioxidants. It‚Äôs considered a form of veganism but with the additional restriction of avoiding cooking or heating foods. 



Nutritional Advantages of a Raw Plant-Based Diet




Higher Nutrient Density




Raw fruits and vegetables are often rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants, vital for optimal health. These nutrients help protect cells from damage, support immune function, and reduce inflammation. For example, eating raw leafy greens like spinach and kale provides abundant vitamins A, C, and K, which support vision, skin health, and bone density. Additionally, raw foods tend to have a higher water content, aiding in hydration. 




Enhanced Digestive Health




Many raw plant foods contain enzymes that assist with digestion. These enzymes help break down food in the stomach, making it easier for the body to absorb nutrients. The proponents of the raw plant-based diet argue that the enzymes found in raw foods can help digestion, reduce bloating, and alleviate constipation. Additionally, raw plant-based foods tend to be high in dietary fiber, which is beneficial for maintaining a healthy gut and preventing digestive issues. 




Weight Management




Because raw plant-based diets are typically low in calories and fiber, they can support weight management. Fiber slows digestion, keeping individuals full for extended periods and reducing the tendency to overeat. In contrast to many processed foods, raw plant-based meals are less calorie-dense, meaning individuals may consume more significant portions without excessive calories. This can result in a natural, sustainable way to maintain or lose weight over time. 




Chronic Disease Prevention




Research suggests that diets rich in fruits, vegetables, and other plant-based foods can help prevent chronic diseases like heart disease, diabetes, and certain cancers. A raw plant-based diet is high in antioxidants, which protect cells from oxidative stress and free radicals. It is known to contribute to aging and the development of chronic illnesses. Raw foods, particularly vegetables like tomatoes, carrots, and bell peppers, are also rich in flavonoids, which have been linked to a lower risk of cardiovascular disease. 



The Myths Surrounding Raw Plant-Based Diets



Despite the benefits, several myths associated with raw plant-based diets deserve clarification. While raw food diets may work for some, they are not necessarily ideal for everyone, and understanding these myths is key to making informed dietary decisions. 




All Nutrients Are Better Raw




One of the most common misconceptions about raw diets is that cooking destroys all essential nutrients, which is not entirely true. Some nutrients, such as vitamin C and specific B vitamins, are sensitive to heat and may degrade during cooking. However, other nutrients, such as lycopene in tomatoes and beta-carotene in carrots, become more bioavailable when cooked. Cooking also helps break down the tough fibers in certain vegetables, making them easier to digest. The idea that all raw food is superior oversimplifies the complex interactions between cooking and nutrient availability. 




A Raw Plant-Based Diet Provides All Necessary Protein




Raw plant-based diets are often criticized for their potential lack of adequate protein. While it is true that many plant-based protein sources, such as beans, lentils, nuts, and seeds, are available on raw diets, they may not always be as concentrated in protein as cooked sources. Moreover, raw diets may lack essential amino acids unless various plant-based protein sources are incorporated. A well-balanced raw plant-based diet must include various plant proteins to ensure sufficient intake. 




Raw Plant-Based Diets Are Safe and Accessible for Everyone




Another myth is that raw plant-based diets are suitable for all individuals. While raw food can certainly be part of a healthy diet, it may not be appropriate for certain groups, such as young children, pregnant women, or those with compromised immune systems. These populations may require additional nutrition from cooked or fortified foods. In some cases, raw foods can also risk foodborne illness due to bacteria and parasites killed by cooking. Thus, individuals considering a raw plant-based diet should consult with a healthcare provider to ensure it meets their specific needs. 




A Raw Plant-Based Diet Will Cure Everything




Some raw food advocates promote that a raw plant-based diet can cure various ailments, from cancer to digestive disorders. While a healthy diet can support healing and prevent disease, it is unlikely that a raw, plant-based diet alone can cure severe medical conditions. Medical treatments, lifestyle changes, and expert guidance are crucial for managing health conditions effectively. 



The raw plant-based diet offers many nutritional benefits, including higher nutrient density, better digestive health, and chronic disease prevention. However, it is essential to acknowledge the myths surrounding this dietary approach. Not all nutrients are better consumed raw, and adequate protein intake can be challenging for some individuals. A raw, plant-based diet may not be suitable for everyone, and it is essential to maintain balance and variety within the diet to ensure nutritional adequacy. 



Ultimately, whether or not to adopt a raw plant-based diet should be a personal decision based on individual health needs and preferences. For those interested in exploring the raw food lifestyle, seeking advice from a registered dietitian or healthcare provider is always recommended to ensure nutritional needs are met.

author: itstimholman
title: "Veganuary Helped Me Be True to Myself"
text: From¬†veganuary.com There is a little-talked-about phenomenon among Veganuary participants. While they may have taken part for a health boost or to do their bit to protect the planet, the month-long vegan pledge can actually help them to discover something much more profound. Here, six Veganuary alumni talk about their paths to inner peace, connecting with their intrinsic values and finding a beautiful sense of freedom.¬† Kim Mogg, SheffieldKim and her boyfriend reached a compromise. He had wanted to bring a pet bird into their home, but Kim was worried about how their dog might react, and so instead they agreed to adopt some hens. Kim contacted a charity that rescues ‚Äúspent hens‚Äù from farms when they would otherwise go to slaughter. ‚ÄúWe wanted to get two,‚Äù she says, ‚Äúbut we came home with four!‚Äù Hens who have been¬†used by the egg industry¬†are often in very poor health, and Kim dedicated herself to giving them the very best life possible. ‚ÄúI like to think my girls are enjoying their retirement,‚Äù she says. As she got to know them better, Kim fell ‚Äúso in love with my feathered girls‚Äù and began to experience a deep sense of disquiet. She realised that she was spending time with them in the garden and then going inside and ‚Äúcooking their sister‚Äù. And that did not sit right with her at all. ‚ÄúIt just got too much for me,‚Äù Kim told us, ‚Äúand I decided in January 2024 to go vegan.‚Äù She is proud to say that she hasn‚Äôt looked back! Today, Kim loves to try out the huge variety of¬†vegan cheeses¬†and cooks with more flavours and colours than ever before. She says she feels less sluggish than before doing Veganuary, and no longer reaches for¬†ultra-processed snacks¬†when hungry. Best of all, that awful sense of guilt has gone. And as for the eggs her rescued girls still lay, well, the postman is always happy to take six when he drops off a parcel. Laura Taylor, TrowbridgeLike Kim, Laura is a true animal lover. She had brought home her first cat ‚Äì an unwanted farm kitten ‚Äì when she was just three years old, and as an adult would regularly hold up traffic so she could help an injured or abandoned animal on the roadside. Unsurprisingly, Laura got a job at an RSPCA cats and dogs centre where she helped animals find a new home. While there, she saw reports of farmed animals being kept in poor conditions and was deeply saddened by them. What may be surprising is that, although Laura switched to a vegetarian diet at times ‚Äì including after watching the film Seaspiracy ‚Äì her default food choices included meat. ‚ÄúI have always struggled with the sense that I‚Äôm an animal lover that still ate meat,‚Äù she told us. That struggle, combined with some digestive issues, led Laura to take part in Veganuary 2024. Laura completely embraced the experience, threw herself into label reading, tried out lots of recipes, and immersed herself in many different films, including Cowspiracy. ‚ÄúOkja had me in bits!‚Äù she says, but she now has all the motivation she could need to stay vegan. ‚ÄúI love that I‚Äôm no longer a hypocrite and don‚Äôt have to wrestle with my beliefs,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúAnd I love knowing that I‚Äôm not eating the animals that I love.‚Äù Ejvor Berg, Lidk√∂ping, SwedenEjvor grew up an animal lover within a hunting family and within a friendship group where everyone ate ‚Äì and still eats ‚Äì meat. She says that she always felt odd, an outsider, and that feeling only amplified when she decided to take part in Veganuary back in 2015. ‚ÄúI wanted to help animals,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúThey are like us, they feel, think, feel fear and pain, and they have wise brains. They‚Äôre smarter than humans. We destroy the world; animals take only what they need to survive and nothing more.‚Äù Today, nine years on from her Veganuary experience, Ejvor has made peace with being thought odd. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm proud to be vegan,‚Äù she says. ‚Äúl sign petitions for non-human individuals in my country and beyond. I support with money when l can. Two years ago, I found a vegan group which is really amazing.‚Äù Some of her friends still try to argue with her which she says can be hurtful, but she knows she has done the right thing. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll not change,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúMy eyes are open.‚Äù Christopher Dallosso, OxfordshireChristopher had known about Veganuary for some time before taking part. He had become interested in the philosophy of veganism because of ‚Äúa vague feeling of something being wrong‚Äù and the more he thought about it, the more hypocritical it felt to him to eat animals. After all, he loved seeing animals out in the wild and would never think of harming them. But deep down, he did not really want to become vegan so he decided to do lots of research to find the reasons he should not take part! ‚ÄúFor every argument against veganism I could find, there seemed to be a stronger counter-argument defending it,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúAs soon as I realised there wasn‚Äôt some fatal flaw with the philosophy of veganism, I started understanding its benefits. Treating all animals as individuals rather than commodities felt like the most important aspect to me, but a heavily reduced impact on the environment and possible health benefits made the switch seem like a no-brainer!‚Äù Christopher took part, and the daily emails he received helped him to navigate a vegan world. Today, he reports that he feels more positive since becoming vegan, which he says helped him complete his GCSEs. He even did a presentation on veganism for his English-speaking assessment, which went really well! But it is the difference Christopher is making in the world that has brought him so much peace. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre so shielded from the atrocities going on in factory farms, we don‚Äôt connect buying animal products in shops with animals being exploited and killed just for our pleasure,‚Äù he told us. ‚ÄúBeing vegan has taken away any feelings of guilt I had about eating certain foods. It feels like a much cleaner and healthier diet, especially if you eat plenty of naturally vegan products like vegetables and pulses. I‚Äôm glad that I can make a meaningful difference to the lives of so many animals and be part of a growing movement towards a more compassionate world.‚Äù Annalisa Botham, BlabyAnnalisa experienced, and thankfully survived, deep and prolonged trauma as a child. In a chaotic, volatile, and violent world, she says it was animals who kept her sane. The cats and dogs who found their way into her family home were her loyal, loving, dependable friends. ‚ÄúI knew how much the animals in my childhood did for me,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúWithout them, I honestly don‚Äôt think I would be here.‚Äù The grief and pain Annalisa carried into adulthood translated into some self-destructive behaviours but through it all she remembered the animals and at times felt as though they were her looking out for her, acting as her guardian angels. ‚ÄúIt was never a spoken thing, but it was a given that I would be forever indebted,‚Äù she says. Annalisa had been vegetarian for a while but was pressed into eating meat again by a person she felt unable to oppose. ‚ÄúIt took me another 10 years, sadly, to go back to being a vegetarian, and then finally vegan,‚Äù she says. But by then, she knew what she had to do. ‚ÄúIt was THE only way if I wanted to be true to my promise and my love of animals. I‚Äôve never looked back because it all ‚Äòaligns‚Äô now. It‚Äôs not even a chore or anything like that; it‚Äôs just love and respect. Now I show animals how thankful I am for their unconditional love.‚Äù Kelly Dibbert, BrightonKelly was a nutritionist and had been taught to promote animal products to her clients. She believed that we need animal protein and fats to be healthy, and bone broth to heal and rebalance. ‚ÄúI now know that not to be true, ‚Äúshe says. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve read countless peer-reviewed studies and researched the science. I have a degree in chemistry so I love to know as much as I can, all the details, all the delicious facts.‚Äù As many of us have experienced, Kelly found that the pro-meat messaging was coming at her from all quarters. ‚ÄúMy parents, the media, friends, restaurants, society, my education had drummed it into me that meat is good,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúIt was like being stuck in a cycle of suffering.‚Äù She says she‚Äôd had qualms about it all, but she wanted to fit in and not stand out or ‚Äúcause a fuss‚Äù. It took many more years before Kelly transitioned to a vegan diet, but she found that the benefits have been enormous. ‚ÄúI now know that I haven‚Äôt given anything up. I‚Äôve gained more self-respect, a richer, more varied and fulfilling diet, and a deep compassion for animals. I bloody love good food, and I‚Äôve learned to really enjoy cooking again.‚Äù Kelly says it feels wonderful not to eat animals and their milk. ‚ÄúI feel lighter emotionally, healthier, empowered and authentically me. I‚Äôm more connected with animals, nature and humanity now that I choose a plant-based diet. I had disconnected from a huge part of the real me by consuming rotting flesh. I am now free.‚Äù ‚ÄúI want to thank Veganuary for giving me that extra little push that I needed,‚Äù she says, ‚Äúand for making it easy. I only wish I‚Äôd followed my heart sooner. Better late than never.‚Äù https://veganuary.com/veganuary-helped-me-be-true-to-myself/

author: somwarad
title: The Benefits of a Plant-Based Diet for Beginners
text:
A plant-based diet is more than just a trend; it is a lifestyle choice that offers numerous benefits for health, the environment, and overall well-being. If you are considering transitioning to a plant-based diet, this comprehensive guide will help you understand its benefits and provide practical tips for beginners. 



What is a Plant-Based Diet?



A plant-based diet primarily focuses on foods derived from plants, including fruits, vegetables, nuts, seeds, legumes, and whole grains. Unlike veganism, which excludes all animal products, a plant-based diet allows for flexibility, meaning some individuals may include small amounts of dairy, meat, or fish while still prioritising plant-based foods. 



Health Benefits of a Plant-Based Diet



1. Improved Heart Health



A plant-based diet is rich in fibre, antioxidants, and healthy fats, which contribute to better cardiovascular health. Studies have shown that individuals who consume more plant-based foods have a lower risk of heart disease, high blood pressure, and stroke. 



2. Weight Management



Many people find it easier to maintain or lose weight on a plant-based diet due to the lower calorie density of plant foods. Whole foods such as vegetables, fruits, and legumes provide essential nutrients while keeping calorie intake in check. 



3. Lower Risk of Chronic Diseases



A diet high in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains has been linked to a reduced risk of type 2 diabetes, certain types of cancer, and Alzheimer‚Äôs disease. Plant-based foods are rich in phytonutrients, which have protective effects against various illnesses. 



4. Better Digestion and Gut Health



Fibre is crucial for a healthy digestive system, and plant-based foods are abundant in dietary fibre. A fibre-rich diet promotes gut health, reduces constipation, and supports a balanced microbiome. 



5. Enhanced Energy Levels



Many individuals who transition to a plant-based diet report increased energy levels. Whole, nutrient-dense foods provide steady energy without the crashes associated with processed foods and high sugar consumption. 



Environmental Benefits of a Plant-Based Diet



1. Reduced Carbon Footprint



Animal agriculture is a major contributor to greenhouse gas emissions. By eating more plant-based foods, individuals can significantly lower their carbon footprint and contribute to a more sustainable planet. 



2. Conservation of Water Resources



Producing plant-based foods requires far less water than animal agriculture. Choosing a diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and legumes can help conserve water resources globally. 



3. Protection of Wildlife and Biodiversity



Deforestation for livestock farming threatens biodiversity. A shift towards plant-based eating helps protect natural habitats and preserve ecosystems. 



How to Transition to a Plant-Based Diet



1. Start Gradually



If you are new to plant-based eating, start by incorporating more plant-based meals into your diet rather than making an abrupt change. Begin with Meatless Mondays and gradually increase plant-based meals throughout the week. 



2. Experiment with Plant-Based Proteins



Protein is a common concern for those new to a plant-based diet. Excellent plant-based protein sources include lentils, chickpeas, quinoa, tofu, tempeh, and nuts. Experiment with different sources to find what you enjoy most. 



3. Diversify Your Meals



Eating a variety of plant-based foods ensures you receive all essential nutrients. Try new fruits, vegetables, and whole grains to keep meals interesting and nutritious. 



4. Plan Your Meals



Meal planning can help prevent reliance on processed plant-based options, which may not always be the healthiest choice. Preparing home-cooked meals using fresh, whole ingredients ensures optimal nutrition. 



5. Stay Informed About Nutrient Intake



While a plant-based diet is nutrient-rich, it is important to ensure adequate intake of vitamin B12, iron, omega-3 fatty acids, and calcium. Consider fortified foods or supplements if needed. 



6. Enjoy Plant-Based Alternatives



There are plenty of plant-based alternatives available, including dairy-free milk, plant-based cheeses, and meat substitutes. While whole foods should be the focus, these alternatives can help with the transition. 



7. Listen to Your Body



Every individual‚Äôs body is different. Pay attention to how you feel and make adjustments to your diet accordingly. Seek professional guidance if needed to ensure a balanced and sustainable approach. 



Common Myths About a Plant-Based Diet



1. Myth: Plant-Based Diets Lack Protein



Reality: There are plenty of protein-rich plant-based foods, such as legumes, quinoa, and nuts. A well-planned plant-based diet can provide all essential amino acids. 



2. Myth: A Plant-Based Diet is Expensive



Reality: A plant-based diet can be budget-friendly when focusing on whole foods like grains, beans, and seasonal vegetables. Processed plant-based foods can be costly, but they are not necessary for a healthy diet. 



3. Myth: You Need to Eat Only Salads



Reality: A plant-based diet is diverse and includes hearty meals like stir-fries, soups, grain bowls, and plant-based pasta dishes. 



4. Myth: A Plant-Based Diet is Difficult to Maintain



Reality: With proper planning and an understanding of nutrient-rich foods, a plant-based diet can be sustainable and enjoyable. 



Delicious Plant-Based Meal Ideas



Breakfast:




Oatmeal with almond milk, flaxseeds, and fresh berries



Avocado toast with cherry tomatoes and a sprinkle of sesame seeds




Lunch:




Chickpea salad sandwich with whole-grain bread



Quinoa and roasted vegetable bowl with tahini dressing




Dinner:




Stir-fried tofu with brown rice and steamed broccoli



Lentil soup with whole-grain bread




Snacks:




Hummus with carrot and cucumber sticks



Mixed nuts and dried fruits




Final Thoughts



A plant-based diet offers numerous health and environmental benefits, making it an excellent choice for anyone looking to improve their overall well-being. Whether you choose to adopt a fully plant-based lifestyle or simply incorporate more plant-based meals into your diet, small changes can lead to significant improvements in health and sustainability. 



Starting with gradual adjustments, experimenting with a variety of foods, and ensuring proper nutrition can make the transition enjoyable and long-lasting. The journey to a plant-based lifestyle is personal, but the benefits are universal‚Äîbetter health, a greener planet, and a thriving, vibrant lifestyle.

author: Isabelle Paquette
title: How Lizzo Reached Her Weight Loss Goal Naturally‚Äî‚ÄòI Am Happy'
text:
Singer-songwriter Lizzo has always been open about her health journey, emphasizing self-love and balance. Today, she‚Äôs hit her weight loss thanks to a combination of mindful eating, realistic expectations and workouts that make her feel strong. With the help of weight loss experts, we‚Äôre diving into why her approach works and how you can incorporate similar practices into your routine. 
Lizzo celebrates reaching her weight loss goal
The ‚ÄúGood As Hell‚Äù singer recently celebrated a major milestone in her weight loss journey, sharing with fans that she officially hit her goal weight. On January 25, the singer posted a mirror selfie on Instagram with the message, ‚ÄúCongratulations! You‚Äôve met your weight goals.‚Äù¬† 

   










View this post on Instagram






















 
A post shared by Lizzo (@lizzobeeating) 


 
In another photo, she zoomed in on her torso, edited with a progress update graphic. ‚ÄúToday when I stepped on my scale, I reached my weight release goal,‚Äù she wrote in the caption. ‚ÄúI haven‚Äôt seen this number since 2014! Let this be a reminder you can do anything you put your mind to. Time for new goals!‚Äù 
She also shared an old video of herself on Instagram stories talking about her ‚Äúintentional weight loss journey.‚Äù In it, she reflected, ‚ÄúEven at the end of my weight loss journey, I‚Äôm not going to be considered thin by any means‚Ä¶ But I will be happy.‚Äù In an updated clip, Lizzo smiled and said, ‚ÄúAnd I am happy.‚Äù 
Addressing rumors about her weight loss
Since sharing her journey on social media, Lizzo has faced speculation that she used weight loss drugs, with comments like ‚ÄúHow you get skinny so fast??‚Äù. In an Instagram post in September 2024, she shut down the rumors, writing, ‚ÄúWhen you finally get Ozempic allegations after 5 months of weight training and calorie deficit.‚Äù¬† 
Rather than turning to weight loss drugs, Lizzo told the New York Times in 2024 that she has been ‚Äúmethodical, losing weight very slowly.‚Äù And that steady, manageable approach is key. 
‚ÄúCaloric restriction and weight training are two of the most important components to weight loss and maintenance,‚Äù explains Amy Lee, MD, Chief Medical Advisor at Lindora.¬† 
As we age, we lose muscle mass, which affects our metabolism or the ability to burn calories. ‚ÄúTogether, [a calorie deficit and weight training] create a balanced approach because the calorie deficit drives fat loss, while weight training enhances strength, metabolism and body composition,‚Äù adds Catherine Gervacio, RND, a registered nutritionist and diet consultant for WOWMD.¬† 
What Lizzo‚Äôs diet looks like: prioritizing protein and energy
After transitioning from veganism, Lizzo now follows a balanced, high-protein diet. ‚ÄúAfter tests and research,‚Äù she said in a TikTok video, ‚ÄúI found that animal proteins helped me have more energy, lose weight and helped with my mental fog.‚Äù Her daily meals, which she often shares online, include lean proteins like grilled chicken and egg whites, fresh vegetables and homemade tea. 
‚ÄúAnimal protein is a complete protein source, providing all essential amino acids that the body cannot produce on its own,‚Äù explains Gervacio. ‚ÄúAnimal proteins such as ocean-caught fish can have higher levels of omega-3, which is great for brain health, [while] red meat has higher levels of B12, which is great for metabolism,‚Äù adds Dr. Lee. 
This isn‚Äôt to say that a vegan diet isn‚Äôt healthy. However, Gervacio notes that ‚Äúwithout proper planning, [it] may lack essential nutrients like vitamin B12, iron, omega-3 fatty acids and high-quality protein, leading to fatigue or deficiencies.‚Äù 
So how do you incorporate more protein into your diet? ‚ÄúHave eggs and fruits or high-fiber bread for breakfast, or have some Greek yogurt with nuts and seeds,‚Äù advises Gervacio. ‚ÄúInclude lean meats like chicken or turkey, or fish like salmon and tuna, along with salads or cooked vegetables, for lunch or dinner. Snacks can be protein-rich options like cottage cheese with high-fiber bread, hard-boiled eggs with salad greens, or beef jerky with fresh fruit.‚Äù¬† 


			
			
							
		
	
	
					
			 Weight Loss			
				
			
				
				    Kelly Clarkson Lost Weight Walking‚ÄîHere‚Äôs How You Can, Too!				
			
		
	

			
			After Kelly Clarkson debuted her striking weight loss in 2023, most heads turned toward Ozempic. While the Grammy Award-winning music star has opted to keep private some of the specifics such as which weight loss drug she used, she‚Äôs been relatively open about her health journey overall. In fact, she offered a glimpse at the [‚Ä¶]		
	


Lizzo‚Äôs favorite workouts: Building strength without stress
Lizzo‚Äôs philosophy is about feeling good and healthy, not achieving a specific look. Her workouts range from intense circuit training and Pilates to jump rope and light treadmill walking sessions. She credits Pilates with helping her heal back pain and build core strength. 
‚ÄúPilates is one of my favorites as it not only can get your heart rate up, but it has added resistant training., And depending on the regimen, pilates on a reformer can help with stretch, which can help with prevention of injuries,‚Äù says Dr. Lee. Additionally, it can help with alignment, posture and breathing, all supporting your back.¬† 
Meanwhile, jumping rope can help your heart. ‚ÄúJumping rope is a high-intensity cardio workout [that] burns a significant number of calories. It improves cardiovascular fitness and strengthens the lower body and core,‚Äù says Gervacio. And Dr. Lee adds that jumping in general can help increase bone density, which improves balance.¬† 
As much as these exercises sound intense, Lizzo reminds her followers to never go overboard or ‚Äústress yourself out.‚Äù When it comes to cardio, she enjoys walking outdoors daily. ‚ÄúI like to walk because any stress, any anxiety, any tension, any anger that I‚Äôve had in my body, I kind of forget about it by the time I‚Äôm done walking,‚Äù she said in a February 2024 TikTok video.¬† 


			
			
							
		
	
	
					
			 Weight Loss			
				
			
				
				    Jessica Simpson Lost 100 Lbs by Walking More‚ÄîCopy Her Success!				
			
		
	

			
			Jessica Simpson‚Äôs weight loss remains arguably one of the most discussed celebrity transformations in the last decade. In 2019, the actress and singer wowed the world with her transformation when she dropped 100 pounds after giving birth to her third child. At the time, the burning question was: how did she do it? (Especially because [‚Ä¶]		
	


Self-love over perfection: Lizzo‚Äôs body positivity message
As a body positivity advocate, Lizzo doesn‚Äôt aim for thinness. She embraces body fluctuations and views health as holistic. ‚ÄúThe idea of body positivity has evolved into body neutrality,‚Äù she explained. Her advice is simple: prioritize health and happiness over external validation. And if you slip up, that‚Äôs okay, too.¬† 
‚ÄúFollowing a healthy lifestyle is all about having a strong mindset,‚Äù says Gervacio. ‚ÄúThis builds habits, and discipline and eventually becomes a part of your lifestyle. Focus on non-scale victories and celebrate improvements in energy, strength, mood or how clothes fit, rather than just numbers on a scale.‚Äù 
How to incorporate Lizzo‚Äôs tips into your routine
Lizzo‚Äôs slow and steady approach to weight loss is one of the healthiest ways to achieve lasting results. Here are some key takeaways from her journey: 

Start small: Incorporate easy habits like drinking more water or adding a short walk outside to your day.
Find balance: Eat nourishing, high-protein meals most of the time, but don‚Äôt deprive yourself of your favorite treats.
Be consistent: Choose workouts or fitness activities you enjoy to make movement sustainable.
Focus on mental health: Address stressors and emotions that may affect your relationship with food and exercise. Rather than getting discouraged by weight fluctuations, understand that they‚Äôre natural and health is ‚Äúmultifaceted,‚Äù as Gervacio emphasizes.



			More celebrity weight loss stories: 
	
					How Mindy Kaling Found Weight Loss Success: ‚ÄòI Eat What I Like to Eat‚Äô 
	
					Nicola Coughlan on Weight Loss: Why the ‚ÄòBridgerton‚Äô Star Wants the Focus on Her Work, Not Her Size 
	
					Chrissy Metz Shares the 2 Key Habits That Helped Her Lose 100 Pounds 
	


	This content is not a substitute for professional medical advice or diagnosis. Always consult your physician before pursuing any treatment plan.

title: How to Be Vegan in Saudi Arabia: Traditional Dishes That Are Vegan
text:
Vegans will find Saudi Arabia to be rich in choice regarding meat-free eateries. Many foods in this category are well-known traditional dishes in the country, with a rich endowment in plant foods. With the right dishes and exploration of the local food, veganism is perfectly doable and pleasant. Here is how to adopt veganism in Saudi Arabia and taste all that traditional food offers:  

How to Choose Traditional Vegan Dishes in Saudi Arabia 
In Saudi culture, many foods are made with fresh culinary production, and the procedure is simple. While discovering these dishes, especially when travelling on religious tours, you can choose dishes that match your Trusted Islamic Travel Agency the most conveniently and comfortably.  

1. Hummus 
It is a tasty opportunity to taste hummus: a paste made of chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, and garlic. We eat it with bread or make sandwiches with it.  

2. Falafel 
Enjoy the taste of the pear-shaped, fried patties made from mashed chickpeas or fava beans called falafel. A scoop of tahini and freshly cut raw vegetables make a great addition to this fast food, packed inside the pita pocket.  

3. Lentil Soup 
Lentil soup includes red lentils, onions, and spices. The Chinese are so right; there's nothing quite as fulfilling and satisfying as soup, as it fills and warms you up.  

4. Baba Ganoush 
Baba ganoush is a thin, purplish-black dip made from grilled aubergines mashed with tahini, chopped garlic, and lemon juice. You know what? It is good for eating, and you can take over bread or vegetables.  

5. Mujaddara 
Try mujaddara, a rice and lentil dish garnished with crispy onions. It is a complete meal plate because it is fully satisfying. 

  

Enjoy Rice-Based Dishes! 
Saudi foods commonly use rice, a key ingredient in many dishes. It is usually best to cook rice dishes as vegan or without non-vegan ingredients.  

1. Mandi (Without Meat) 
Order the mandi without meat. It includes spiced and still has some juice and taste; the spiced rice can be served with salad or any vegetable.  

2. Kabsa (Without Meat) 
Ask for kabsa without meat. This particular rice meal can satisfy people's desire for a meal produced from spices in preparation.  

3. Harees (Vegan Version) 
So, when you order harees, ensure that all ingredients are grains and spices. They can be vegan when changed because many cook this meal at home.

 

Try Saudi Bread! 
Bread is also among the Saudi food; most bread is appropriate for a vegan diet. With a Hajj Umrah visa, you can easily explore vegan-friendly options during your trip.  

1. Tamees 
You can bake Tamees as flatbread in a tandoor or oven. They make an excellent vegetable dip and are ideal to accompany hummus, lentil soup, or baba ganoush.  

2. Pita Bread 
It can be used to make sandwiches or complement some dishes. Put falafel, several vegetables, and even tahini sauce in it, and you have a complete meal.  

3. Za'atar Bread 
This food could be ordered as za'atar bread with olive oil, sesame seeds, and thyme sprinkled on top. It is more flavourful when consumed as a snack or familiar with other foods. 

  

Indulge in Date-Based Treats! 
Dates are a part of Saudi Arabian tradition and a food ingredient. They can be purchased almost anywhere and come in many forms.  

1. Fresh Dates 
Eat some fresh dates. It will make you sweet and refreshed if you ever have low energy. Some famous dates are Ajwa, Sukkary, and Khidri.  

2. Stuffed Dates 
Stuffed dates filled with almonds or coconut are a nutritious food for dessert.  

Discover Vegan Snacks 
You can find several vegan snacks in Saudi Arabia made from essential ingredients, including:  

1. Foul Medames 
Order foul medames. This meal is prepared from fava beans, garlic, and lemon juice. It is a perfect snack when eaten with flatbread.  

2. Vegetable Sambousek 
You can choose sambousek from eggplants, bell peppers, zucchini, potatoes, cauliflower, squash, or spinach. These pastries are good for breakfast.  

3. Roasted Chickpeas 
Spiced roasted chickpeas make a great snack because they are light and easily digested. They are delicious, natural, crisp, and perfect, especially as a vegan. 

  

Sip on Vegan-Friendly Drinks 
Saudi Arabia brings refreshing vegan drinks suitable for taking with meals.  

1. Mint Tea 
It is important to note that mint tea does not interfere with most conventional menus in any way. You can order it for a light meal and still feel like you've just taken a breath.  

2. Jallab 
The tasty Jallab is made from grape molasses, dates, and rose water. It is warm on hot days. 

  

How to Eat Vegan in Saudi Arabia? 
Follow these tips to make your vegan journey with Umrah packages in Saudi Arabia smooth and enjoyable:  

Ask for customisation: Specify your order with servers and request food free from meat and dairy products. Restaurants respect people's dietary choices.Visit Middle Eastern restaurants: Eating in restaurants serving food from your chosen country is good. This includes more vegan meal options.Shop at local markets: You should buy your groceries, such as fruits, vegetables, and grains, to prepare your meals, as these are considered fresh. I must admit that vegetarian meals are not challenging because many restaurants have vegetarian meals. 

  

Final Thoughts 
In conclusion, being vegan in Saudi Arabia is quite simple if you go to the correct destinations (we have already written about being in vegan in Hail). The country's cuisine offers many excellent meals for those who believe in plant-based food. The Saudi people, in particular, say it is the best for food. They are not limited in their choices when on a diet, they can have lentil soup and falafel, for example. 

 

Let yourself face a vegan part of Saudi Arabian food and enjoy every traditional dish. Therefore, if you have a Hajj Umrah visa, you can taste vegan-friendly meals during your trip! (Second photo by Christopher Alvarenga on Unsplash)
